backend/main.mo: Actor implementing user profiles with APA skill levels, access control, and detailed match record types for multiple game modes.
backend/migration.mo: Migration module converting old user profiles to the new format by adding a nullable APA skill level field.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report mapping requirements to frontend files for APA skill-level editing and auto-fill behavior.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Text file summarizing the purpose of each frontend component and page in the application.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind CSS setup defining light/dark theme variables and global styles.
frontend/index.html: Base HTML document loading the root React application.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main React entry configuring routes, theming, auth gating, and layout structure.
frontend/src/components/apa/ApaBallButto: UI button for selecting APA ball states with styling and accessibility labels.
frontend/src/components/apa/apaBallStyle: Provides helpers for ball state labels, ball values, and calculating total rack points by player.
frontend/src/components/apa/ApaRackScori: Rack scoring component handling ball states, innings flow, auto-dead ball logic, and rack completion.
frontend/src/components/apa/ApaResultsSu: Displays a match summary card showing winner, match points, and detailed stats for both players.
frontend/src/components/apa/useApaInning: React hook managing inning flow, tracking active player, inning counts, and ball activity.
frontend/src/components/auth/AuthGate.ts: Gate component that checks authentication state and shows login or app content accordingly.
frontend/src/components/auth/LoginButton: Login/logout button handling Internet Identity auth flow and query cache resets.
frontend/src/components/auth/ProfileSetu: Dialog for creating or editing a user profile with name and APA skill level fields.
frontend/src/components/layout/AppLayout: Main layout with header, footer, routing outlet, login controls, and profile editing dialog.
frontend/src/components/matches/DeleteMa: Button and confirmation dialog to delete a match and navigate or trigger a callback.
frontend/src/components/matches/EndMatch: Dialog that confirms ending a match session and triggers a save action.
frontend/src/components/matches/MatchSum: Displays a clickable match summary card with mode, date, players, and mode-specific score formatting.
frontend/src/components/navigation/ModeC: Renders a card with icon, title, description, and a button that navigates to start a new game mode.
frontend/src/components/players/ApaAggre: Generates PPI and match‑result trend charts with rolling averages using Recharts.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and manages the backend actor tied to Internet Identity, refreshing dependent queries on identity changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides Internet Identity login, logout, and state management via a React context and AuthClient.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Wraps backend actor calls with React Query for profiles, matches, and accepting‑gifts state, including mutations and cache invalidation.
frontend/src/index.css: Defines Tailwind base styles and CSS variables for light and dark themes.
frontend/src/lib/accepting-gifts/accepti: Implements state transitions for Accepting Gifts, including ball count clamping, scoring, and set progression.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaAggregateStats.t: Extracts APA match stats for a player and provides helpers for PPI, points, rolling averages, and date formatting.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaEqualizer.ts: Defines APA skill levels and maps them to required points, with helpers for validation and formatting.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaMatchPoints.ts: Contains APA 9-ball match point conversion charts and outcome thresholds based on loser points.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaScoring.ts: Implements APA 9-ball rack scoring, PPI calculation, validation helpers, and player stat aggregation.
frontend/src/lib/matches/matchBuilders.t: Builds APA 9-ball match records from input parameters, computing PPI and assembling rack and player data.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Initializes React app with query client and Internet Identity provider.
frontend/src/pages/accepting-gifts/Accep: Manages Accepting Gifts drill gameplay state, persistence, scoring, and match saving.
Displays rules and guidance for the Accepting Gifts drill.
Start page for the Accepting Gifts drill, handling player setup, baseline object ball persistence, and initializing game state in session storage.
Runs an APA 9-ball practice match, updating rack-by-rack scoring, persisting state, and determining match completion.
frontend/src/pages/apa/PracticeStartPage: Start page for APA practice matches, collecting player names and SLs, calculating targets, and creating the initial game state.
frontend/src/pages/history/MatchDetailsP: Displays detailed information for a single saved match, including players, mode, date, and stats.
frontend/src/pages/history/MatchHistoryP: Lists all saved matches with filtering by mode and links to individual match summaries.
frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx: Renders the app home page with navigation cards for game modes and match history.
frontend/src/pages/players/PlayerAggrega: Shows aggregate APA stats for a specific player, including wins, PPI, innings, and defensive shots across all matches.
frontend/src/pages/straight-shot/Straigh: Main gameplay UI for the Straight Shot drill, handling stroke/scratch tracking, session persistence, and match saving.
Static rules panel describing objectives and scoring for the Straight Shot drill.
Start screen for creating a new Straight Shot session with player input and moving‑average stats preview.
frontend/src/utils/playerName.ts: Utility helpers for normalizing and comparing player names case‑insensitively.
frontend/src/utils/playerRoutes.ts: Builds route paths for navigating to a player's stats page.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Helpers for reading, persisting, and clearing URL parameters with session storage fallback.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration extending theme colors, fonts, animations, and plugins.
project_state.json: Project metadata and architectural notes describing app features, rules, and known issues.
